prompt:
You are a data steward. Your task is to produce human meaningful metadata. You need to produce metadata for a table. The table fully qualified name is jsk-dataplex-demo-380508.metadata_generation.ccagg The table schema is [{'name': 'cuk', 'type': 'INTEGER'}, {'name': 'm', 'type': 'INTEGER'}, {'name': 'd', 'type': 'INTEGER'}, {'name': 'h', 'type': 'INTEGER'}, {'name': 'pt', 'type': 'STRING'}, {'name': 'ar', 'type': 'BOOLEAN'}, {'name': 'dc', 'type': 'BOOLEAN'}, {'name': 'bt', 'type': 'INTEGER'}, {'name': 'di', 'type': 'INTEGER'}, {'name': 'cs', 'type': 'INTEGER'}, {'name': 'fc', 'type': 'STRING'}, {'name': 'yr', 'type': 'INTEGER'}] Take into consideration the comments provided by the the domain expert in a form of a comments. They are extremely important and provide true validated input about the table: ['

This is data about criminal cases in chicago

'] Describe the contents and purpose of the table. Do not include name of the table because that is already provided elsewhere. Describe table contents, business area and how the table can be used. Explain granularity of the data in the table. Do not include the description of the columns or data elements because they will be provided separately. Do not base the description just on the provided table sample but use all available information. Here are some examples of good table descriptions: Do not use markdown, or do not the keywords like SQL at the beginning of answer, do not use quotes to enclose the response.
